alert.note: Alert for Culebra; Mayaguez and Vicinity; North Central; Northeast; Northwest; San Juan and Vicinity (Puerto Rico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Juan (San Juan, Puerto Rico)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Warning issued December 08 at 9:54PM AST until December 10 at 2:00AM AST by NWS San Juan
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 AM AST SATURDAY... ...HIGH SURF WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 AM AST SATURDAY... ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH SUNDAY AFTERNOON... ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 2 AM SATURDAY TO 6 PM AST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Dangerous surf conditions and rip currents expected due to breaking waves of around 15 to 20 feet. Beach erosion and isolated coastal flooding is expected. * WHERE...Beaches of Culebra and the U.S. Virgin Islands, and from northwestern to northeastern PR. * WHEN...For the High Surf Warning and Coastal Flood Warning, through 2 AM AST Saturday. For the High Rip Current Risk, through at least Sunday. For the High Surf Advisory, starting 2 AM AST Saturday through at least 6 PM AST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Dangerous swimming conditions. Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water. Hazardous breaking waves. Coastal flooding and beach erosion. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A long period northerly swell continues to invade the Atlantic coastal waters of the islands. This swell could suddenly produce larger breaking waves along the northern beaches of Puerto Rico and the U.S. Virgin Islands. Breaking waves are expected to reach 15 to 20 feet, and beach erosion is posible. The next high tides will be: for San Juan at 9:35 AM AST tomorrow at 1.77 feet and 8:34 PM AST tomorrow at 0.81 feet; for Culebra at 9:20 AM AST tomorrow at 1.32 feet and at 8:13 PM AST tomorrow at 0.55 feet; for Charlotte Amalie at 9:48 AM AST tomorrow at 0.94 feet; for Christiansted at 9:31 AM AST tomorrow at 0.89 feet.
info.instruction: A Coastal Flood Warning means that flooding is occurring or imminent. Coastal residents in the warned area should be alert for rising water, and take appropriate action to protect life and property. A High Surf Warning indicates that dangerous, battering waves will pound the shoreline. This will result in life-threatening conditions. A High Surf Advisory means that high surf will affect beaches in the advisory area, producing localized beach erosion and dangerous swimming conditions. All persons should refrain from entering the waters, due to the risks associated with high surf conditions and rip currents.

area.areaDesc: Culebra; Mayaguez and Vicinity; North Central; Northeast; Northwest; San Juan and Vicinity
